pullRequest.body:
More missing cdots found by the multiGoal linter (#12339).

---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

</details>

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô

  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>

üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11136120822/job/30947361038)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11136120822/job/30947361305)

I'm wondering if commenting about the "handling two goals at once" in the two more tricky proofs would be useful. Apart from that, LGTM. Thanks!
maintainer merge

I'm wondering if commenting about the "handling two goals at once" in the two more tricky proofs would be useful. Apart from that, LGTM. Thanks!
maintainer merge
Are there actually two goals here, and closing the first one discharges the second as a side effect?

Yes, the other goal is
```lean
Submonoid.powers r ‚â§ Submonoid.comap f (Submonoid.powers (f r))
```
and it disappears once the previous goal is closed.

I'm not sure about the `on_goal`: in this case
```
¬∑ conv => lhs; arg 2; rw [mul_comm, ‚Üê mul_assoc]
  move_mul [‚Üê (constantCoeff R) œÜ ^ (n' - 1)]
  conv => enter [1, 2, 1, 1, 2]; rw [‚Üê pow_one (a := constantCoeff R œÜ)]
  rw [‚Üê pow_add (a := constantCoeff R œÜ)]
  conv => enter [1, 2, 1, 1]; rw [Nat.sub_add_cancel h']
  conv => enter [1, 2, 1]; rw [mul_comm]
  rw [mul_assoc, ‚Üê one_add_mul, add_comm, mul_assoc]
  conv => enter [1, 2]; rw [mul_comm]
exact h'
```
would have worked equally well.
I used the focusing dot instead.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: add a few focusing dots 3
